title: How to get 90 marks in class 10 maths in 30 days - Quora

response.answer_text: Heyi Rekha .. Here's a link to a similar question that I answered previously Do check it out… Stuti Goel's answer to How did you prepare for the class 10 boards before scoring 90% above? Okay! So u r left with around a month… To score above 90... Make plans and schedules for these 30 days.. Like for the first week (7days) take your NCERT. Revise your entire NCERT in these 7 days, each question, each example thoroughly. Divide these 7 days according to the weightage of the chapter…take a mix combination of a hard chapter and a simple chapter…for eg- a combination of surface area and volume and probability. For the 2nd week practice extrra questions….do the maximum no. Of hard or extra questions that you could practice…either from RD or from exemplar or any other book that u prefer…Mind it dont waste your entire time/month over hundreds of questions in each ch in RD sharma. Check this out… Stuti Goel's answer to Should I complete RD Sharma in the last 3 months of class 10? For the 3rd and the 4th week, practice as many sample papers as you can.. Go for ulike, Arihant, last year's boards question papers…practice the way of answering questions, the way of presenting answers, time management and all… That is must ! Well it's just a game of 3 hours! Thankyou soo much for reading Hope this helps… You may check out my other similar answers related to boards in case of further doubts. All the best for exams Do well :) Stuti ..

(I initially saw this question to be one of those spam questions about maths that you can answer in your head so will answer that one later) First some real advice. Mathematics is a subject where, a lot of the time, later elements build on something you’ve already been taught. If you’re struggling with something you may need to review the foundations you’re trying to build upon. As Anam Khan said in his answer You can do it, concentrate, learn and practice. If you reach a point where it’s not making sense try to take a step back and see if you can work out why you don’t ‘get’ it and review the foundation again. (Now my original answer) It depends on the day you start and what time you give to this. If we assume you start on a Monday and work from Monday to Friday on this 30 days from then will give you 22 working days so you will need 4.09 marks per working day. If you start your 30 days on a Saturday then you will only have 20 working days which means you will need 4.5 marks per day. If you’re working every day then you only need 3 marks per day. Start as soon as possible and do some of the work at weekends as well.
